subject: Re: Junit reporting
msgSnippet: ... methods executes same testconditions with a list of input data. When one of my test case condition fails, JUnit reports failure and aborts from further
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com> , "Selvaraj,
Lourduraj \(TCS, EB&T\)" <lourduraj.selvaraj@...> wrote:
>
> Hi All,
> I am using JUnit for regression testing. One of my test case
methods executes same testconditions with a list of input data. When one
of my test case condition fails, JUnit reports failure and aborts from
further executing the other test data.
>
> While it reports the failure, I would love it to execute the other
tests also in the test method and report their results. Is there a way
to make JUnit it to report alone and ignore the failures to continue
testing.

You could use junit ant task properties haltonfailure="off" and
haltonerror="off". Example:

<junit fork="yes" printsummary="on" haltonfailure="off"
haltonerror="off" errorproperty="test.errors"
failureproperty="test.errors">
...
</junit>

The error property above can be used later to fail the build if any of
the tests failed:

<!-- Run the batch ignoring failures -->
<junit ...>
</junit>

<!-- Fail if there were failed tests in the batch -->
<fail message="TESTS FAILED" if="test.errors"/>

By the way, if you use this approach running tests under Parabuild you
can see how the tests are doing over time:
http://www.viewtier.com/products/parabuild/what_is_new_in_parabuild_2_1_\
junit.htm
<http://www.viewtier.com/products/parabuild/what_is_new_in_parabuild_2_1\
_junit.htm>

Hope this helps.

Regards,

Slava Imeshev
